title: Strengthening Management Strategy Competencies: Digital Problem-Based Learning Course for Engineering Design Education

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary engineering concepts and basic proficiency in digital tools
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world engineering problems and derive design solutions using digital collaboration tools.

Learners can conduct weekly knowledge-sharing sessions with ≥3 peers via online collaboration platforms (e.g., Microsoft Teams, Slack) over a 6-month course, improve project proposals ≥3 times by incorporating ≥5 peer feedback instances.

Learners can simulate three stages of the engineering design process (requirements analysis, prototype development, verification) using a hybrid learning model (online lectures + offline workshops), and submit deliverables (requirements specification, prototype drawings, verification reports) with ≥80% completion per stage.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
